intro: Aniseia carnea, commonly known as the red-veined ivy, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its striking, heart-shaped leaves with prominent red veins. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage. Aniseia carnea prefers shady, moist environments and is relatively easy to care for in a garden setting.
